MS MCQs

    Introduction to Hyperscale (Citus) on Azure Database for PostgreSQL

    »

    1. What are the characteristics of OLTP workloads?

      High numbers of transactions with large amounts of data

      Business intelligence and analytical workloads

      Time series data

      High numbers of transactions with low amounts of data


    2. Why do multi-tenant applications provide massive cost savings?

      OLAP workloads involve low amounts of data

      The combined workloads of multiple tenants is low

      Many customers share resources.

      Recent cloud advances in storing large amounts of data.


    3. What is a benefit of sharding?

      OLAP workloads only need to access a single node to run queries

      Sharding allows efficient distribution of your data to multiple servers, allowing a level of performance that is impossible to achieve on a single server.

      Queries can be combined into a single, master query.

      Sharding allows applications to directly query worker nodes, removing the need for a coordinator node.
